Collect and store rainwater: If all rain stopped, the best way to water your plants would be to collect and store as much rainwater as possible. This can be done by installing rain barrels or other collection systems in your garden. Once you have collected enough water, you can use it to water your plants as needed.

Use greywater: Greywater is the wastewater that comes from activities like showering, washing dishes, and laundry. You can collect and reuse greywater to water your plants. This can be done by installing a greywater system in your home.

Use a drip irrigation system: A drip irrigation system delivers water directly to the roots of your plants, minimizing water waste. This can be an effective way to water your plants, especially if you have a large garden.

Use a watering can: If you don't have access to a rain barrel or greywater system, you can use a watering can to water your plants. This is a simple and effective method, but it can be time-consuming if you have a large garden.

Use a hydroponic system: A hydroponic system is a method of growing plants without soil. It involves using a nutrient solution to provide the plants with the necessary nutrients and water. This can be an effective way to grow plants, especially if you don't have access to rainwater or greywater.
